channel.title: Why ASM Inlines the Constant Pool?
channel.description: I've heard there are "advantages," but seen no real explanations. I see direct access to the constant pool as pretty useful. It can be searched for values instead of searching each method of a class, etc. Why in the world would ASM inline it then?

item.title: Why ASM Inlines the Constant Pool?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Objects are easier to deal with than references to objects. Also creating and deleting such ‘objects’ is a PITA.

Read full topic
item.source: Why ASM Inlines the Constant Pool?

item.title: Why ASM Inlines the Constant Pool?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

why in the world would you want to have to reference the constant pool when making a lightweight visitor pattern bytecode library

l2p
